section.title: sme_affix
section.p: This file is a manually created affix file for North Sami.

section.title: The format of the affix file
section.p: Affix is either a prefix or a suffix that can be attached to root words to make other words. Here is an example of how to define a suffix.
section.source: SFX I Y 5 SFX I a ii [^ij]a SFX I 0 i [ij]a SFX I e ii e SFX I 0 i [iá] SFX I i ái i
section.p: The first line has 4 fields.

ol.li: SFX indicates this is a suffix
I is the name of the character which represents this suffix
Y indicates it can be combined with other affix entries
5 indicates it has 5 entries stored in this prefix

section.p: The remaining lines describe the information for the 5 entries.

ol.li: SFX indicates this is a suffix
I is the name of the character which represents this suffix
a the string of chars to strip off before adding affix
ii the prefix string to add (a 0 indicates the NULL string)
[^ij]a the conditions which must be met before prefix can be added

section.title: The wordlist sme.wl
section.p: The list sme.wl contains 1000 lines (why?). For the words A-vitamiidna and some other vitamins, it has full paradigms, whereas for place names it has only stems. Why?
Because sme.wl is only a dummy file?
Because the proper nouns have been enrolled in the sme_suffix.dat file, and therefore are represented only by their stems, whereas the vitamins are unenrolled, and therefore represented by fullforms?

section.title: Adding flags to wordlist
section.p: Flags are inserted to the wordlist with munch-list aspell command. Munch-list takes the wordlist sme.wl and affix information file sme_affix.dat and generates a munched wordlist with wordroots that have appropriate affix tags.
The munching must be done in small bits, because it consumes RAM very much. The plan is to use 1 million words at a time, and catenate the output into one uniform wordlist.
After the wordlist has been munched, it can be compressed and the output is a compressed wordlist sme.cwl.

section.title: The file sme_phonet.dat
section.p: In aspell common misspellings are given more weight than other substitutions. This can be a part of sma_affix.dat file (it will then be MySpell compatible), but in aspell it is done as a separate file sme_phonet.dat
